body:
Support for Gradle 7 and parallel builds (thanks @eyalroth and @helfper)
- https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/pull/166 
- https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/pull/165
- https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/pull/162
- https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/pull/161
* https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/pull/159 Support mixed Java/Scala modules using Java annotation processors (thanks @grollinger)

* Use Scala full version in plugin and binary version in runtime (thanks @helfper )
* Update to Gradle 7.1

* Support Scala 2.13 with Scoverage 1.4.2
* Drop support for Scala 2.11 and prior versions of Coverage
* Fix Gradle BuildCache (https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/pull/147, thanks @CristianGM)
*  Make the plugin compatible with Palantir's consistent versions plugin

* Fix ScoverageReport task inputs declaration (@CristianGM)
* Allow dependency project not to use scoverage (@JozoVilcek)

Thanks both.

* 4.0.0 does not work with scala 2.11 (https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/issues/125)
* De-duplicate coverage files
* Annotate ScoverageRunner for use with Gradle 6.0

* support for scala 2.13.1 (https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/issues/106, https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/issues/109)
* support for `java-platform` (https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/issues/121)
* cannot configure check task (https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/issues/120)
* do not automatically apply the plugin to subprojects (https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/issues/118)

With thanks to @eyalroth for many fixes.

* Fix #112 - specific module in multi module project without normal compilation 
* Better scala version detection 

Thanks to @eyalroth for the changes.
* Fixes a remaining 2.11 bug (thanks @alisiikh)
* restores support for Scala 2.11 (https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/issues/94)
* restores support for Java sources (thanks @alisiikh)
* Fixed bug: ConcurrentModificationException during project evaluation - thanks @alisiikh
* fix publishing to maven central

* https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/pull/100 Collect scoverage from all tasks - thanks @alisiikh 
* https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/pull/99 Performance enhancement - thanks @tpetrov-rms

Thanks to @eyalroth for the recent updates.

* Auto resolution of scalac plugin dependencies.
* Aggregation task declared by default.
* Deletion of non-instrumented classes, allowing for better integration with other coverage tools such as cobertura.
* Ability to execute coverage without "normal" compilation, thus reducing build times.

Bug fixes:

* #81 IOException on Windows when registering task output files

Bug fixes:
* https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/issues/78 compilation is duplicated
* https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/issues/74 testing of covered code is not cached

Additional features:
* scoverage tasks are now part of the verification group

* Cachable tasks
* Removes the unexpected dependency on scalac-scoverage_2.11 from version 2.2.0 published to the Gradle plugins portal

* better support for the Gradle build cache
* support `implementation` and `testImplementation` configurations
- Remove support for the Ant compiler as it is removed from Gradle 3.0
Fix https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/issues/55 - code in src/main/java is not correctly compiled

- Publish the plugin to the gradle plugin repository. 

This requires a change to the plugin identity to meet their convention.

``` groovy
apply plugin: 'scoverage'
```

becomes:

``` groovy
apply plugin: 'org.scoverage'
```

or you can use the new plugin mechanism:

``` groovy
plugins {
  id 'org.scoverage' version '2.0.0'
}
```

- include scoverage jars in the runtime dependencies of the instrumented classes. This simplifies the use case where there are multiple forms of test which should be included in code coverage measurements. It may represent a breaking change for some users.

- support European locales when checking overall coverage. 

Thanks to @NullStress for the contributions.

- publish `scoverage.xml` for aggregated reports
- support enforcing minimum coverage at line, statement or branch levels

Thanks to @kwestor for the contributions.

- Fix: Resources not copied during instrumented compilation
- Feature: scoverage xml output is now written into the report directory (to support Sonar Qube upload)
- Feature: an experimental aggregated report task is now available for users to configure.

- Incomplete classpath in multi-module project https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/issues/13
- Zinc / Ant compatibility https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/issues/29
- HTML links https://github.com/scoverage/gradle-scoverage/issues/6

- Handle an issue when spaces exist in the path to the plugin jar. This was discovered with a _GRADLE_USER_HOME_ under _c:\Documents and Settings\User_
- Provide a sensible error message when the plugin jar cannot be found in the scoverage configuration

name: 1.0-5-g9c68988
body:
- Publish binaries that are compatible with JDK6
- Publish to maven central
- Support scalac-scoverage 1.0 and higher
